intro: Linaria hirta f. semiglabra, commonly known as the hairy toadflax, is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow-orange flowers. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is native to parts of Europe and western Asia. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or borders. Its delicate flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
